page.title: 09HEALTH
page.content:
HEALTH -OLD AGE PROVISIONS BRYN LLEWELYN HOME FOR THE AGED Grid 69-42. RUN BY:Gwynedd County Council and opened in 1964. Formerly the home of Lord Newborough. Also has been St.Francis School for Wayward Boys with Father CHARLES as head. Also SUMMERHILL SCHOOL run by Mr. Neil during the War years. For many years it was run as an orphanage by the old Merioneth County Council. As a Home the first appointed as Matron in l964 was Mrs. ELLEN MARGARET WILLIAMS. In JULY,l985 there were 4 men and 22 women registered there and they come from Barmouth,Dolgellau,Harlech,Dyffryn, Penrhyndeudraeth,Trawsfynydd and the Ffestiniog area. STAFF: 12 women, 2 men. MATRON:Mrs. ANN JOHN (Deputy) >>>
END
